themes: need for transparent and consistent funding processes
value of listening to diverse community voices
role of infrastructure (affordable spaces, hubs, networks) in creative ecosystems
balancing urgent equity work with long-term sustainability
key_phrases: actively listening to both new and long-established voices
public trust depends on transparent processes, culturally competent communication, and consistency in funding
creative ecosystems thrive not just through grants, but through infrastructure—like affordable spaces, community hubs, and peer networks
balancing urgent correction with long-term sustainability requires steady dialogue, course correction, and care
barriers_identified: overreliance on grants without supporting infrastructure
solutions_proposed: actively listen to both new and long-established voices
support creative ecosystems with infrastructure like affordable spaces, community hubs, and peer networks
balance urgent equity correction with long-term sustainability through steady dialogue and course correction
